title: Blockfall on the North Polar Layered Deposits
description: The North Polar layered deposits (NPLD) are a stack of layers of ice and dust at the North Pole of Mars. The layers are thought to have been deposited over millions of years, as the atmosphere changed in response to the varying tilt of the planet’s axis.
